item.title: cmd/compile: enable -G=3 by default (I1f62d6c0) · Gerrit Code Review
STRICT Tables
item.description: SQLite strives to be flexible regarding the datatype of the content that it stores. For example, if a table column as a type of "INTEGER", then SQLite tries to convert anything inserted into that column into an integer. So an attempt to insert the string '123' results in an integer 123 being inserted. But if the content cannot be losslessly converted into an integer, for example if the input is 'xyz', then the original string is inserted instead. See the Datatypes In SQLite document for additional information.
